Title: Thalamic input to inferior area 6 and area 4 in the Macaque monkey
Abstract:
Recent cytoarchitectonic, histochemical, and hodological studies in primates have shown that area 6 is formed by three main sectors: the supplementary motor area, superior area 6, which lies medial to the spur of the arcuate sulcus, and inferior area 6, which is located lateral to it. Inferior area 6 has been further subdivided into two histochemical areas: area F5, located along the inferior limb of the arcuate sulcus, and area F4, located between area F5 and area 4 (area F1). The present study traced the thalamocortical projections of inferior area 6 and the adjacent part of area 4 by injecting small amounts of WGA-HRP in specific sectors of the agranular frontal cortex. Our data showed that each histochemical area receives a large projection from one nucleus of the ventrolateral thalamus (motor thalamus) and additional projections from other nuclei of this thalamic sector. Area F5 receives a large projection from area X of Olszewski ('52) and additional projections from the caudal part of the nucleus ventralis posterior lateralis, pars oralis (VPLo), and the nucleus ventralis lateralis, pars caudalis (VLc) (VPLo-VLc complex). Area F4 receives a large projection from the nucleus ventralis lateralis, pars oralis (VLo), and additional projections from area X and the VPLo-VLc complex. The rostral part of area F1 is innervated chiefly by VLo, plus smaller contributions from rostral VPLo and the VPLo-VLc complex. The caudal part of F1 receives its greatest input from VPLo, with a small contribution from VLo. In addition, each histochemical area receives projections originating from the intralaminar thalamic nuclei, the
posterior thalamus, and--for area F4 and area F5--also from the nucleus medialis dorsalis (MD). Analysis of the physiological properties of the various histochemical areas in relation to their main thalamic input showed that those cortical fields in which distal movements are predominant (area F5, caudal part of area F1) are innervated chiefly by area X and VPLo, whereas those cortical fields in which proximal movements are predominant receive their main input from VLo. Because VPLo and area X are targets of cerebellothalamic pathways, whereas VLo receives a pallidal input, we propose that the cortical fields in which distal movements are most heavily represented are mainly under the influence of the cerebellum, whereas the cortical fields in which proximal movements are most heavily represented are mainly under the influence of the basal ganglia.

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Citation: "According to Olszweski ('52), VLo laterally borders on the lamina medullaris externa. However, because the most lateral part of the nucleus has a structure without clusters, following Asanuma et al. ('83a), we will not consider this region as a part of VLo, but rather as an extension of the more posterior thalamic nuclei (VLc, VPLo)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Results similar to those in Fig. 7 [IT6-5] were obtained from monkeys IT6-8..."

"The results of monkey IT6-5 are presented in Figure 7. The most heavily labelled thalamic nucleus was area X. Dorsal to area X, the labelling extended into VLc, with a few labelled cells (not shown in the figure) also present ventrally in VLm and laterally in VPLo.Caudally, many marked neurons were observed at the junction between VLc and VPLo (VLc-VPLo complex). Outside the ventrolateral thalamus, labelled cells were present in the nuclei centralis lateralis (Cl), centrum medianum (Cn.Md), and medialis dorsalis (MD). Labelling in the last nucleus was rather intense and occupie its ventrolateral part. Finally, a few marked cells were found in the nucleus pulcinaris, pars oralis (Pul.o)."

"The results of monkey IT6-5 are presented in Figure 7. The most heavily labelled thalamic nucleus was area X. Dorsal to area X, the labelling extended into VLc, with a few labelled cells (not shown in the figure) also present ventrally in VLm and laterally in VPLo.Caudally, many marked neurons were observed at the junction between VLc and VPLo (VLc-VPLo complex). Outside the ventrolateral thalamus, labelled cells were present in the nuclei centralis lateralis (Cl), centrum medianum (Cn.Md), and medialis dorsalis (MD). Labelling in the last nucleus was rather intense and occupie its ventrolateral part. Finally, a few marked cells were found in the nucleus pulcinaris, pars oralis (Pul.o)...
Results similar to those shown in Figure 7 were obtained from monkeys IT6-8 and IT6-7. In this last animal (monkey IT6-7, Fig. 8), some labelled cells also were found in VApc and VLo."

"Labelled cells were found in VLo and in VLm, but the most densely labelled nucleus was VPLo (see Table 3). Labelling was found also in the VLc-VPLo complex, in Cl, and in Cn.Md. CLusters of marked cells were present in LP, but not in Pul.o. Area X and MD were completely devoid of marked neurons."

"In this monkey [IT4-2], the injection was made in the rostral part of F1... In addition to VLo, labelling was found in VLm, in VPLo, and caudally in the VLc-VPLo complex. Some labelled cells were observed also in Cl and Cn.Md.... area X and MD were devoid of marked cells. The posterior labelling was restricted to LP."

"... in addition to labelling in VLo, the VPLo is an even more heavily labeled nucleus... No labelled cells were found in area X. Some labelled neurons were observed caudally in the VLc-VPLo complexand a few in Cl and Cn.Md... MD was devoid of labelling, whereas LP contained labelled cells."
"Figure 19 shows the location of the labelled cells after this injection (monkey IT4-5)."
"...VLo ... was very densely labelled. Clusters of labelled cells were present in VPLo and in the VLc-VPLo complex. Cl and Cn.MD were also labelled."
"... labelled cells in VPLo and the complete absence of them in Area X and MD."

"After the rostral injection (monkey IT4-7R), an intense labelling was foung in the lateral most part of area X, extending in the rostral sections into VLo. Posteriorly labelled cells were found in the zone at the junction between VLc and VPLo. Both MD and Cl were labelled. Some marked cells were found in Cn.Md, Pul.o, and LP."

"A predominance of labelled cells in area X was also found in monkey IT6-2, in which the injection was made near the arcuate sulcus... In addition to the labelling in area X, labelled cells also were found in this monkey in VApc, VLo, VLm, VPLo, and in the VLc-VPLo complex."

"... the most heavily labelled thalamic nucleus is area X... No labelled cells were present in VLo. Some labelling was found in VLm, VPMpc, and caudally in the VLc-VPLo complex... there was a heavy labelling in MD and in Cl. A moderate number of marked cells were found in Cn-Md and Pul.o."

"Figure 9 illustrates the thalamic labelling after an injection in area F4. In this animal (monkey IT6-6), the most intesely labelled thalamic nucleus was VLo...
In addition ..., retrograde labelling was found in area X, in VLm and caudally in the VLc-VPLo complex.
...labelled cells were also present in MD, Cl, and a few in Cn.MD. Posterior labelling included the nucleus lateralis posterior (LP) in addition to Pul.o."

publication.title: Thalamic input to inferior area 6 and area 4 in the Macaque monkey
publication.abstract:
Recent cytoarchitectonic, histochemical, and hodological studies in primates have shown that area 6 is formed by three main sectors: the supplementary motor area, superior area 6, which lies medial to the spur of the arcuate sulcus, and inferior area 6, which is located lateral to it. Inferior area 6 has been further subdivided into two histochemical areas: area F5, located along the inferior limb of the arcuate sulcus, and area F4, located between area F5 and area 4 (area F1). The present study traced the thalamocortical projections of inferior area 6 and the adjacent part of area 4 by injecting small amounts of WGA-HRP in specific sectors of the agranular frontal cortex. Our data showed that each histochemical area receives a large projection from one nucleus of the ventrolateral thalamus (motor thalamus) and additional projections from other nuclei of this thalamic sector. Area F5 receives a large projection from area X of Olszewski ('52) and additional projections from the caudal part of the nucleus ventralis posterior lateralis, pars oralis (VPLo), and the nucleus ventralis lateralis, pars caudalis (VLc) (VPLo-VLc complex). Area F4 receives a large projection from the nucleus ventralis lateralis, pars oralis (VLo), and additional projections from area X and the VPLo-VLc complex. The rostral part of area F1 is innervated chiefly by VLo, plus smaller contributions from rostral VPLo and the VPLo-VLc complex. The caudal part of F1 receives its greatest input from VPLo, with a small contribution from VLo. In addition, each histochemical area receives projections originating from the intralaminar thalamic nuclei, the
posterior thalamus, and--for area F4 and area F5--also from the nucleus medialis dorsalis (MD). Analysis of the physiological properties of the various histochemical areas in relation to their main thalamic input showed that those cortical fields in which distal movements are predominant (area F5, caudal part of area F1) are innervated chiefly by area X and VPLo, whereas those cortical fields in which proximal movements are predominant receive their main input from VLo. Because VPLo and area X are targets of cerebellothalamic pathways, whereas VLo receives a pallidal input, we propose that the cortical fields in which distal movements are most heavily represented are mainly under the influence of the cerebellum, whereas the cortical fields in which proximal movements are most heavily represented are mainly under the influence of the basal ganglia.
